title: Americans Start Summer Travel Season Beset by Record Gas Prices
sub_head: National average for gasoline finished May above $4.60 a gallon
body:
Millions of Americans hit the road over Memorial Day weekend, with record-high gas prices pinching their wallets.
The national average price for a gallon of regular unleaded gas hit $4.62 as of Monday, according to AAA, $1.58 higher than a year earlier and about 12% above the pre-2022 high of $4.11 set in 2008. Prices have risen about 11% over the past month, the organizationâ€™s figures indicated, and gas was recently above $4 in all 50 states.
